dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - A YOUNG WOMAN'S EYE. Bloodshot blue. Her eyelashes tremble. A tear rolls out. She blinks. CLOSE ON - A filthy, coarse rope secures a dirty rag insi her mouth. CLOSE ON - The same type rope binds her ankles together. CLOSE ON HER HANDS - A mixture of blood, dirt.   IRON SPI ARE NAILED THROUGH HER PALMS. FROM ABOVE - The Young Woman, 20s, wearing a handmade dre with a small crest embroidered over the heart, lies naile a wooden table.

dialogues.speaker: AN OVERHEAD LIGHT BULB DIMS, CRACKLES. OFF SCREEN
dialogues.text: CURDLING SCREAM cries out. The Young Woman's breathing intensifies.   She watches th light bulb, listens to the screams. The light bulb returns to normal. The screams stop.    Pe for a moment. But she knows that won't last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG MAN, 20s, hangs by his wrists from iron shackles secured to the ceiling. He's bloodied, bruised... a mess. CLOSE ON - The end of a pair of jumper cables. They TOUCH sending SPARKS into the air. Brought together by... A CONCEALED FIGURE. All that's visible are his hands. left hand is SEVERELY BURNED, SCARRED, while his right appears normal. He touches the jumper cables together again... SPARKS FLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please-please stop. D-don't. The Concealed Figure ignores his pleas, connects the left cable to one shackle chain... and then the right side.

dialogues.speaker: ELECTRICITY SURGES THROUGH THE BODY OF THE YOUNG MAN. HIS
dialogues.text: BODY CONTORTS. HE SCREAMS. The lights DIM and CRACKLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - The light bulb DULLS.   The screams of the You Man echo through the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Woman closes her eyes. Takes SEVERAL FAST BREAT then... MUSTERS every ounce of strength in her body and.. Her right hand TREMBLES... The Young Woman GRIMACES, in unbelievable agony, but then... HER RIGHT HAND INCHES UP IRON SPIKE. Slowly and painfully. PIECES OF BLOOD, SKIN a BONE cling to spike as the hand moves up. The light bulb returns again to normal.   The screams sto The Young Woman gives a final hard push and...   FREES HE RIGHT HAND. Blood pours from the wound. No time to waste. She turns her attention, strength to he left hand... ever-so-slowly (and painfully) it moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - The jumper cable attaches to the metal and... ELECTRICITY SURGES THROUGH THE YOUNG MAN'S body. HE SCREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Woman's left hand POPS free.    Blood oozes out OFF SCREEN: SCREAMS FROM THE YOUNG MAN. She sits up, goes for the gag, but her fingers cramp in p Finally, she unties the knot, removes the gag. She coughs tries to muffle the noise best she can. The SCREAMS STOP.   Lights return to normal. Half way free. She goes for the ropes at her ankles, unti them, slides off the table. She grabs a couple rags, ties them around her palm's wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Woman opens the door, checks to see if the coas clear. It is. We're at the end of a long, dark hallway (more like a tun really). There are two more doors in the hall, one in fro of her another to her right. The door across from her is slightly ajar... YOUNG WOMAN'S POV THRU DOOR - The Young Man dangles from chains. Suddenly, the Concealed Figure appears between th door and the Young Man. The Young Woman retreats, but realizes the Concealed Figu has his back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE YOUNG MAN sees past the Figure, LOCKS EYES with the Y Woman. No hope for himself, his eyes say: Save yourself. The Young Woman fights back tears, mouths the words "I Lo you". She carefully opens the door to her right, REVEAL a rickety set of wooden steps. She heads up, just as... LIGHTS FLICKER.     OFF SCREEN: The Young Man SCREAMS aga The Young Woman quickens her pace. The SCREAMS drown out sound, until... just before she touches THE TOP STEP... The lights return to NORMAL.       The Young Man STOPS sc The place goes silent. The Young Woman's foot TOUCHES THE STEP...       A LOUD C RINGS OUT. The Young Woman FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: TORTURE ROOM
dialogues.text: The Concealed Figure TURNS towards the sound.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY, STAIRS--
dialogues.text: The Young Woman holds her breath.       Did he hear her?

dialogues.speaker: TORTURE ROOM
dialogues.text: A STEEL AXE/SICKLE hybrid (a scary, handmade invention), rusted, save for the razor sharp edge, sticks in a nearby wooden horse. The Concealed Figure SNATCHES the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY, STAIRS--
dialogues.text: Sarah (Young Woman) bolts up the remaining steps.

dialogues.speaker: TORTURE ROOM
dialogues.text: The Concealed Figure rushes for the door.      In pursuit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH races through the thick forest. Her bare, bloody fe and legs stomping over the hard dirt, branches, shrubs, anything in her way. Not too far behind... THE CONCEALED FIGURE... (the majority of him still hidden follows her. WEAPON IN HAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH... pushes through some thick brush, but... trips, falls. She SCREAMS IN PAIN, grabs her foot, notices... A LARGE GASH ACROSS THE BOTTOM. Sarah turns, hears... THE CONCEALED FIGURE.. approaches in the distance. SARAH... wills herself up, limp/runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah exits the thick woods to discover, to her horror... STANDS AT THE EDGE OF A CLIFF, takes a peek over the side SARAH'S POV - JAGGED ROCKS and a small STREAM at the bott 200 feet below. A WATERFALL flows steadily nearby. Before Sarah can fully digest the situation... THE CONCEALED FIGURE exits the forest, SPINS THE WEAPON i his hand. Anticipating its use. Sarah FREEZES in her spot. Breaths get shorter, heavier. Her eyes dart in every direction. What to do? The Concealed Figure TAKES ONE STEP FORWARD and... SARAH JUMPS OFF THE CLIFF. Rather that fate than the other. The Concealed Figure walks up to the edge, looks over... AT THE BOTTOM... Sarah's dead body lays twisted and blood among the rocks. The waterfall crashes next to her. BLOOD mixes with the water turning it a deep RED. CUE TITLE: TIMBER FALLS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black four-door VW Passat cruises the interstate.     A duffel is strapped to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. PASSAT, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: MIKE WARREN, late 20s, with a devilish grin and looks to kill, sits at the wheel. Even a flashy pair of sunglasses can't mask the twinkle in his eye. SHERYL JAMES, late 20s, rides shotgun. This beauty's got all: toned bod, sharp mind and a heart-stopping smile. An opened bag of chips sit in her lap. A couple of Diet Cokes in the cup-holders. She cradles a cellphone MP3 player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Flipping through tunes) Chill...I gotta find -- alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got one? Sheryl hits the "Play" button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Warning Shots", Thievery Corporation. Mike grins.   Sheryl rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   Next one. Sheryl scrolls again, hits play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Bullets" by the Editors. Sheryl frowns.   Mike grins and shoots her a wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You loaded these songs. You don't need to be so impressed with yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I don't have to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't even heard of half these bands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called good music. You should try to familiarize yourself with it, instead of listening to the crap you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I listen to crap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurts me to be the one to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be more like me, baby. Think new, fresh, cutting edge. I'm looking for the next Beatles, U2 or Radiohead. Sheryl scans through the MP3 player, spots one and smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, where does this band fall into that group? The music starts. BOY'S DON'T CRY, "I WANT TO BE A COWBOY blares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fresh, new or cutting edge? Mike immediately begins to backtrack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd that get on there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You loaded the songs.   You tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says here you've listened to it 86 times. Busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this true? Have you always wanted to be a cowboy? Sheryl spies more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You also got "Men Without Hats" greatest hits? I didn't know they qualified for a greatest hits album. Can you break me off a little "Safety Dance"? Mike reaches for the MP3 player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, give me that. The Passat speeds past a "West Virginia" state sign. SHOOTING SCRIPT           OCTOBER 17, 2006          7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun BURNS above.   The Passat turns into the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Passat rolls into a dirt parking lot. Next to the lot the Ranger Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maps and local artifacts adorn the walls. A display of so of the local animals, stuffed of course, including a gian bear, fill in the gaps. Mike and Sheryl enter. They take in the place. Mike heads toward the Ranger's desk while Sheryl eyes the decor. SAM, 65, a round-faced RANGER with a grumpy disposition, hearing aid in his right ear, sits behind a desk. He continues working, scribbling on something as Sheryl and wait. And wait. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. Sam holds up a "wait a second" finger.     After a beat..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what can I do you two for? Sheryl spots some fliers tacked to a bulletin board. Hiki gear for sale, Tour Info, National Park History, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...ah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time here and you're not quite sure where to begin. Sheryl grabs a National Park Information flier. ANGLE ON - There are pictures, an Emergency Contact Information, Guided Tour Info, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely like that. Sam stands, grabs his lower back, a recurring discomfort. he digs around for something... SHOOTING SCRIPT           OCTOBER 17, 2006          8. Sheryl notices, on the board... ANGLE ON - A flier for a young missing couple.     Below ANGLE ON - A photo of a girl: "Sarah Travers"(from the opening scene). Sheryl studies it and shakes off any concern by locking a with Mike at the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get you started with one of these. Sam grabs a map and lays it out in front of the couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you folks hiking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days.    Heading out early Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you move at a decent clip, you could hit the summit by midday tomorrow. Should still give you time to take it all in and make it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any particular path?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You folks experienced hikers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've done some ah--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No. Nothing like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For first-timers, I recommend either Willow Creek Bridge or Donner Trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donner Trail? As in "The Donner Party?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure of the name's origin. They're the two paths we regularly patrol. Something happens and you're on one of the other trails, it might be awhile before we find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do we camp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless it says not to, you can set up where you like. Just make sure when you turn in that you extinguish your fire. Oh, and this here's bear country. They're not animals to fool with. You see one, you head the other way, especially if he's feeding. If the bear thinks you're getting in the way of his food, that's all she wrote. Sheryl warily eyes the stuffed Bear in the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sarcastic) Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got yourself a first aid kit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Betty here's my first aid kit. Sam looks confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mind him. I'm a nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. The question was, do you have a first aid kit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we have a first aid kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, see how easy that was. (Moving on) It's off-season, park's pretty quiet. Even more than usual. You may run into a few locals, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People live up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a few generations of families that have called these mountains home. Most of `em are friendly. Respect their land and they'll respect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike twangs and air banjos, "Dueling Banjos" from `Deliverance.' Sam is not amused. Sheryl fights her temptation to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Moving on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Base is just outside, to the left. At about two miles up there'll be a junction where you can pick your path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Mike and Sheryl offer a smile and quickly exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Sheryl exit.     They burst out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike digs through his backpack, double-checking everythin What he doesn't show Sheryl... wrapped in some socks: a . Revolver. He tucks it discreetly away. Sheryl checks her bag as well. She clips a blue hikers' t to her waist. Mike checks his cell phone. No service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You getting anything? Sheryl checks her phone and shakes her head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll lock them in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to annoy you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously... SHOOTING SCRIPT           OCTOBER 17, 2006         11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an emergency, I'd rather have a phone that may not work up there, than not have a phone that may work up there. Huh? Mike shakes his head, puts his phone in the glove compartment. Sheryl tucks her phone and the flier into a side pocket o her backpack. Zips it shut. ANGLE ON - Mike's keys and his Boston Red Sox key chain. Mike locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we all set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do this. Mike pulls on his backpack, starts walking. Sheryl doesn' move. She eyes their tent still resting on the car's roof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Einstein. What do you think, leave the tent or maybe take it with us? Mike swallows his pride and retreats to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just seeing if you were paying attention. Mike comes back to the car for the tent.   Sheryl shakes head and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mountain is breathtaking.    Nature at its best. Mike and Sheryl have begun their ascent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a chance. High School reunions serve only two purposes... to try to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rehash so-called glory days if you were popular or to gloat if you were a spaz and are now filthy rich, banging a super-model. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what were you? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?   I was a stoner. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what does that mean? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell am I supposed to remember? I was high all the time. Sheryl swallows some water, checks her compass. Sweat rolls down Mike's forehead, stinging his eyes. Sher doesn't have that problem. She's wearing a red bandana. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that bandana? SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cute, right? I stopped by that Army-Navy store on Grover yesterday. Keeps the sweat out of your eyes. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you were buying it, you didn't think that maybe... SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...well...it was the last one... MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last one? SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire Army-Navy store... sold out? SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely. There was some sort of run on bandanas at the last minute. Sheryl stifles a CHUCKLE. Mike shakes his head, then... s pulls out a GRAY BANDANA, hands it to him. SHOOTING SCRIPT               OCTOBER 17, 2006   13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... You big baby. Sheryl turns, as she does... Mike pinches her behind, she playfully SHRIEKS, hustles away from him, but he pursues as they both CRACK UP, they spill off the trail... OFF THE PATH... Mike and Sheryl continue their horseplay, when... SHERYL LOOKS DOWN, SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: A BLOODY, MUTILATED FOX LAYS INSIDE A RUSTED BEAR TRAP. T
dialogues.text: Steel jaws of the trap have sliced the body in two. The k looks fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it's a, or was, a fox. Come on. Mike and Sheryl head back to the path. ANGLE ON - The MUTILATED, BLOODY FOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Sheryl hike over a small wooden bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Sheryl reach a small clearing. There are a numbe signs pointing toward different trails. (Donner Trail, Wi Creek Bridge, Timber Falls, etc.) Sheryl grabs the map and some water. Mike swigs some wate munches on trail mix, takes a peek in the guidebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?    "Cannibal" Trail or the other one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guidebook says a couple of these other trails lead to some pretty sweet views.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not Lewis and/or Clark. We're gonna stick to one of the ones the Ranger said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IDA (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You folks need some help? IDA FOSTER, 40s, approaches, wheeling some supplies in a handmade wagon. She is worn, haggard, but has a friendly, smile. She wears a flannel shirt, old jeans and dirty boo MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just going over our options here. IDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, take it from me, any way you choose, you can't go wrong. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ranger at base suggested Donner Trail or... IDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Willow Creek Bridge. I think Sam only knows those two trails. Well. Between those, I'd pick Donner Trail. Willow Creek will shoot you to the top, but there's not as much to see. Donner weaves through Peddler's Point, it's a better hike and prettier all around view. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Mike) What do you think? Then, she notices a ring on Sheryl's finger. IDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a pretty ring. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. IDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not your traditional wedding ring, but it's all the same in the Lord's eyes. How long have you two been wed? Sheryl and Mike trade looks. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... we're not married.    Not yet anyway. Mike shoots her a look: "not yet?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a ring my father gave me for graduation. IDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Oh, I'm sorry. You just looked like you was married is'all. Both so beautiful. (Beat) I'm just an old fashioned silly-bird. I need to mind my own business. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's fine. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing topics) Which one of those trails got the best clearings? IDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearings? Neither will give you much in the way of clearings. But, there's another path, this one here. (Points to the map) Timber Falls. Its got some beautiful vistas and one of the prettiest falls you'll ever see. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds perfect. (To Sheryl) Yeah? IDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll leave you to it. Last thing you need is me fussing'round you, taking you from your private time.

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL MIKE
dialogues.text: Thank you.                        Yeah, thanks for the ti Ida walks off, but stops only a few feet away. IDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna say it and go, but if you two were to marry... I bet the Lord would bless you with a happy, healthy and handsome child. Good luck and God bless you both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl and Mike don't know how to respond.      Ida leave out of earshot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suddenly feel the need for confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Still lingering on...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet? Love taking your shots, don't ya? Sheryl shoots him a stern, but playfully sexy, look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I see an opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Checks map)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That path she was talking about winds through these falls. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... if you get eaten by a bear and there isn't a Ranger around, I'm not carrying what's left of you down this mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they say romance is dead. (Smiling wide)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timber Falls it is. They throw on their backpacks and head on their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Lewis and/or Clark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really were stoned through high school. As Mike and Sheryl trek up the path... ANGLE ON - The directional sign, "Timber Falls"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking back down on the thin path. FIND - Sheryl and Mik continuing their trek. (SPLINTER UNIT) Mike maneuvers around a massive tree. He freezes. Gesture for Sheryl to be quiet and mouths the words, "Don't Move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl stops, startled.     Mike motions towards... A MOUNTAIN STAG, with magnificent antlers, chews on a pla in the distance. Sheryl quietly slides out her digital camera.    Snaps a of the animal. The Stag stops chewing and looks at them.    After a long the Stag skips away through the trees. Sheryl watches the animal disappear, smiles. Mike removes his backpack and crosses to Sheryl. He helps remove her backpack and kisses her. She kisses him back. ANGLE ON - Sheryl's heart-shaped locket through her shirt MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to lose that out here. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. I never take it off. Not since you gave it to me. Betcha don't remember... MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...February 27, 2006. Sheryl stares incredulously, romantically at Mike. Speechless. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember every moment with you. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got you so whipped. They kiss. Sheryl climbs onto Mike's lap. He leans back, better positioning, places his hand down, when... MIKE

dialogues.speaker: OUCH
dialogues.text: Mike brings his hand back up.    BLOOD trickles out of a CUT across his palm. SHERYL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hand... Something stuck it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl quickly examines the cut. Mike quickly becomes flustered, woozy. He turns away from the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's not too deep.      Let me get the first aid kit. Sheryl rummages through her bag. Mike, in more psychologi discomfort than physical, looks away wincing. Sheryl returns, wipes the blood away best she can.    She applies some peroxide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.   That stung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta clean the wound, baby.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH TREES--

dialogues.text: HE LUNGES FOR SHERYL, but misses.     She runs through th into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sheryl rushes into the room, but trips on something. When she gets up, the first thing she sees... THE FETUS J She coughs violently, almost pukes.     She stumbles, hur the trap door steps... A moment later... The Concealed Figure pops through the iron door.       Fo first time we see the Concealed Figure wholly... THIS IS DEACON. Half his body scarred, burned. He stands well over six feet tall, muscles rippling everywhere. A frightful sight. He peers up the trap door steps, pursues Sheryl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl BURSTS through the front door, running for the woo Deacon exits the cabin, spots Sheryl.     Runs after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL runs as fast as she can. Breaking branches in her way, leaping rocks. Anything to get away from... DEACON follows. This is his terrain, turf.      He moves and efficiently through the brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL looks back, and as she does... trips over some tre roots. She falls FACE FIRST INTO A GIANT PUDDLE. She push herself out of the puddle. She's soaked, but doesn't stop She resumes running. DEACON... closing the gap. SHERYL, confused, scared and lost, looks around wildly. no idea where she's going. Then suddenly she hears something. She looks down a slight hill... SHERYL'S POV - A RANGER TRUCK drives along a gravel road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you God... (At the top of her lungs)

dialogues.speaker: HELP
dialogues.text: Sheryl darts down the hill, and falls out onto...

dialogues.speaker: I/E RANGER TRUCK/ GRAVEL MOUNTAIN ROAD
dialogues.text: The RANGER TRUCK SLAMS on the brakes, inches from running over Sheryl. She SLAMS her arms down on the hood. Clyde, startled beyond belief, looks out at Sheryl. He ge out of the car, goes to her. She HUGS Clyde tightly, star crying. He looks at her... the blood, cuts, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my stars, what happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Out of breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to help me. I was kidnapped. My boyfriend came... And this man's chasing me. He's chasing me right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. I can't make heads or tails of what you're saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming. He's right behind me. Clyde looks up into the woods from where Sheryl came, but all's peaceful at the moment. No Deacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, miss, there's no one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE FROM DOWN THE PATH - Clyde, his back to us, console Sheryl. Deacon steps into frame. Sickle/Axe in hand. He starts toward Clyde and Sheryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be fine, Miss. I promise you. Everything's going to be fine. Sheryl pries her face from Clyde's chest. SHERYL'S POV - Deacon's five feet behind Clyde and closin SHERYL SCREAMS.   CLYDE HOLDS ONTO SHERYL. Off her look, Clyde turns... DEACON AND CLYDE STAND FACE FACE. The moment's frozen. For too long. Something's not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon, what's going on?    How the heck did she escape? Sheryl looks at Clyde, in shock.    Deacon lowers his hea ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want something done, gotta do it yourself. Clyde removes a black, wooden club from his belt... Shery turns, about to run, when... CLYDE CRACKS HER ACROSS THE BACK OF THE HEAD WITH THE CLUB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERYL'S POV - OUT OF FOCUS, WOBBLY. LIGHTS, a rainbow of FUZZY COLORS DANCE BEFORE US. Slowly, bring into focus... Sheryl coughs, gags on something. SHERYL'S POV - She lifts her arms to discover her wrists tied together tightly. SHERYL'S POV - Ida enters the room carrying something. Sheryl's breath quickens. Ida walks right up to Sheryl. places a FLOWER WREATH in her hair, adjusts it to fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. Just perfect. You are lovely as a summer's day. (Checks her watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost time. Sheryl catches her REFLECTION in a small wall mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON - A ROPE looped through a hook in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW THE ROPE DOWN... PASS A PAIR OF BLOODY AND BRUISED
dialogues.text: HANDS, WRISTS... keep going... end on Mike. Mike's passed out. He dangles in the middle of the room. wears an old, moth-eaten sports jacket and slacks. A rope gags his mouth. ANGLE ON - the SICKLE/AXE.   As it moves towards Mike... Deacon, a black ring surrounds his injured eye, steps in front of Mike, holds the blade CENTIMETERS from Mike's ey An eye for an eye? Mike wakes and... immediately freaks out. He tries to sha loose, but can't. Deacon stares at him, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon! Clyde enters. He wears a long garment around his neck, carries a bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough. Get him ready. Deacon backs off. He undoes a slipknot on the far wall, which causes Mike to come CRASHING to the floor. Deacon lifts Mike to his feet, positions him. It's only now Mike gets a gander at the room. The FETUS JARS adorn the far wall. There's a giant WOODEN CROSS hanging over a makeshift altar. CANDLES anywhere an everywhere. An old phonograph, one that you CRANK to play, rests in t corner. Clyde places the needle down on a record, CRANKS WHEEL. The MUSIC kicks in, CLASSICAL RELIGIOUS... It's hollow, full of static and futz. Mike watches... HIS EYES OPEN WIDE, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The iron door slowly CREAKS open. ANGLE ON - A FILTHY PAIR OF WHITE DRESS SHOES. Ropes secu the ankles so movement's limited to inches at a time. Shimmying into the room, wearing a dusty, old wedding dre and a flower wreath in her hair is Sheryl. Her wrists sti bound. Her mouth gagged. Mike and Sheryl take each other in. Tears spring to Shery eyes. She takes another jerky step closer. Ida is visible behind her, guides her towards Mike. She positions her next to him so that both face the altar. Clyde glances to Ida who silences the music. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, "Each man should have his own wife, and each woman her own husband. The husband should fulfill his marital duty to his wife, and likewise the wife to her husband." IDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so, in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ, I ask you Michael... and you Sheryl, do you accept the sacred covenant of marriage? Mike and Sheryl stare at Clyde.   Neither flinch. Clyde glances to Deacon, who immediately steps forward, touches the sickle blade to Sheryl's throat. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ask again... Do you accept this covenant of marriage? Sheryl nods immediately.   Mike nods too. Clyde signals for Deacon to step back.   He obeys. CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then by the power vested in me, I pronounce you man and wife. Clyde signals to Ida.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ida removes Sheryl's graduation ring from her finger. She then slides TWO TARNISHED GOLD BANDS, one on Sheryl's fin the other on Mike's. Clyde unties the rope securing Mike's gag in his mouth, removes it. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this? We did nothing to you people. Let us go! CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may kiss the bride. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking people are fucking sick! Clyde's temper flares... CLYDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Stern and cold) Do not use that type of language in this house again. Now... kiss the bride or... (Gestures to Deacon) ... he'll cut off your lips. Mike stares in horror at Clyde, turns to Sheryl. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Mike kisses her briefly on the cheek. Clyde smiles satisfied, nods to Deacon. He immediately li Sheryl up and throws her over his shoulder. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Deacon carries her from the room.   Sheryl CRIES. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: LET HER GO
dialogues.text: (To Clyde) Let her go!...Please, let her go! Clyde pulls the ropes, hoists Mike back into a dangling position. He secures the knot before exiting the room. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: SHERYL
dialogues.text: (To Ida) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE (cont'd) Please. Don't hurt her. Whatever it is you want, I'll give it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stuffs the gag in, secures it in place with the rope. She ties the knot. Perfect. Ida exits the room.     Mike is alone. Mike tries to yank his hands through the knot. His wrists and hands turn red, his face is flushed...the knot is too tight. He stops. Mike takes a breath and tries again. His face and hands a beet red. He pulls and pulls...but the rope doesn't budge Mike exhales. It's no use. He dangles there, helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resting under the FULL MOON, sits the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: A INT. CHAPEL
dialogues.text: Mike still dangles by his wrists.    Clyde enters. Clyde unties the end of the rope on the floor.      The r UNFURLS, Mike DROPS to the ground. Clyde picks him up, sits him in a nearby chair. Mike's wrists, ankles and mouth still bound and gagged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna untie your mouth, now.    Have a little "man to man" talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde undoes the gag in Mike's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... It's not too late.    Let us go.    We won't tell anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat) How well do you know your bible, Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Fucking Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde SLAPS Mike across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you before to watch that mouth, mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Clyde PUNCHES him, not once, but twice.    He readies a t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You through? Mike spits some blood on the floor.    Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ask again... how well do you know the bible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. It's fine. That's why I am here... teach you the way things are and the way they should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl sits in a chair in the middle of the room. Still gagged. She wears a new outfit. A handmade dress with a small crest embroidered over the heart. IT'S SIMILAR TO T ONE WORN BY SARAH (GIRL FROM THE OPENING SCENE OF FILM). Ida pulls tight the rope securing her wrists to the arms the chair. Satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back. Ida exits the room. Deacon stands by the door.        He Sheryl alone together. Sheryl tries not to make eye contact. Deacon stares at her.     Longingly. DEACON'S POV - On Sheryl's chest, expanding and contracti with every breath.

dialogues.speaker: ON DEACON
dialogues.text: DEACON'S POV - Sheryl, a heavenly glow encircles her (and gag mysteriously gone), turns to Deacon. A look of calm a lust in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you, Deacon. (Jump Cut to...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to fuck me.   Hard. ON DEACON - His stare deepens. Sheryl, the heavenly glow gone, her gag back in place. Watches Deacon. She squirms, cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde sits in a chair next to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord knows the will of a man gets tested. Cruelly most times. But the righteous persevere. They do what needs to be done, even though they don't want to. It's what makes a man, a man. Let me tell you the story of Judas, he was one of Jesus's apostles. Judas led Roman Soldiers to the capture and eventual death of our Lord Jesus Christ. And now, is supposedly seated next to Satan, his soul burning in hell forever for this sin. But I don't believe that's the case. I have my own theory. The death of Jesus was predicted thousands of years before Judas ever came along. And for the prophecy to be fulfilled, Jesus had to die. If he didn't, the gates of heaven couldn't be opened for mankind. I don't think, for an instant, Judas wanted to be the one, but... someone had to. Judas helped Jesus, so Jesus could die for our sins. Save us all. And I believe at this moment... Judas is in heaven, despite his sin, because it led to the greater good. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relations prior to marriage is a sin. You and Sheryl are sinners in the Lord's eyes. And because of those sins, your souls are damned. But Ida and Me, we're gonna give you a chance to save your souls and do the right thing, but... as previously stated, you will need to persevere and show the strength and will of your character. But you'll do it. Because that's what needs to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stares unflinching at Clyde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon kneels before Sheryl who tries to move, but can't. ANGLE ON - Deacon lays his scarred hand on Sheryl's thigh Sheryl squirms, but that's all she can do.       Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon! Deacon jumps up, backs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get away from her.    Git!   Now! Ida sets a tray she was carrying down, chases Deacon from room. She shuts the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about that, Sugar.     My brother, he's not well. She retrieves the tray, brings it over closer to Sheryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not all his fault. Our father wasn't very Christian and then there was the accident. Along with the scarring, lost use of his vocals. Can't speak a lick. Now, I've spoken to him. What happened with the others won't happen to you. He's promised me that. What others?   What did he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take that out of your mouth now. I brought you some tea, got some primrose in it. Help you relax, get some rest. Okay? Ida unties the gag in Sheryl's mouth. She coughs a few times. Ida raises the mug of tea to her lips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't do this. Please let me go. Please..I just want to go home. SHOOTING SCRIPT         OCTOBER 17, 2006             65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink the tea. Ida brings the mug to her lips again, pours some in Shery mouth. She swallows a big gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better. Good girl. (Changing topics)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost forgot to ask... How does it feel being married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd be happy about that. All I ever wanted out of life was two things... to be married and to have a baby. The Lord blessed me with Clyde and I thank Him every day for that. Ida pours some more tea into Sheryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But having a baby's been... complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde walks over to the fetus jars.    Stares at them. sadness in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can conceive fine... just... can't seem to make it all the way through. Timothy was the toughest... Made it to month eight. ANGLE ON - The "Timothy" Fetus jar.    The most developed them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: City Doctor had some fancy mumbo-jumbo words for the condition. (Beat; turns to Mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaks my heart every time. That woman was born to be a mother. It's her calling in life. Just like you and Sheryl have a calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly do you want from us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The IRON DOOR FLIES OPEN, Deacon emerges, stands over Mik

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl sways back and forth.     Her EYELIDS heavy.   The primrose "kicking in." Ida places her hand on Sheryl's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're young, strong... It's gonna be easy for you. Not like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Barely conscious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh-what...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna have a baby, Sheryl. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon drags Mike down the hall.    Clyde follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the room FLIES OPEN.    Deacon drags Mike ins Clyde right behind them. To Mike's horror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... Sheryl lies unconscious on top of the table, Ida by her s ANGLE ON SHERYL - Each of her limbs tied down with heavy rope. Her legs are spread apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be out for hours, but she's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ida'll come back in a little bit, check to see that the deed has been done. If it hasn't...the next time you see your little lady...a piece of her will be missing.

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTING SCRIPT OCTOBER 17, 2006 67.
dialogues.text: CLYDE (cont'd) (Cold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't test us on that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, we know conception's not automatic. So don't feel like all the pressure's on right now. We're prepared to do this however long it takes. You give us the effort each time, eventually the magic will happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your fucking minds. Clyde grabs Mike's wrist, turns over his palm.    Clyde t knife from his belt, SLICES MIKE'S PALM. MIKE SCREAMS.   BLOOD POURS FROM THE WOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I tell you about the language? Ida grabs a fresh rag, wraps Mike's hand in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon will be right outside that door. The only door. This room has no windows and is buried twenty feet below ground. Cutting to the chase... there's no way out and you can scream yourself hoarse, no one will hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll let you have your privacy now. (Remembers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, almost forgot. Ida goes to the corner where the phonograph sits.    She the handle, places the needle on the record. The record crackles, Pachelbel's "Canon" fills the room. Deacon, Clyde and Ida exit.   They SHUT and LOCK the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon stands by the door.    Ida and Clyde, holding hand walk towards the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gotta work this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me. (Beat; he doesn't...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me, Clyde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. Clyde wraps his arm around Ida's shoulder, comforting her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike makes his way to the table, to Sheryl.    He pulls h to his feet. He takes Sheryl in. She looks peaceful. He runs his good hand through her hair. Tears roll down his cheeks. Mike checks each of Sheryl's ropes.    They are all tight secured. Mike haphazardly checks every nook and cranny of the room But Clyde was right. No way out. Mike stares at the phonograph...    HE KICKS IT OFF THE T KICKS AND BASHES IT TO PIECES. VFX: Mike's breathing INTENSIFIES. PUSH INTO TIGHT CLOSE UP... His world is not caving in, it's already caved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME LAPSE... The night sky rapidly changes from black to blue. The Sun RISES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl's head falls to the side, bumps the table.     She She finds Mike is passed out sitting in a chair, his hand holding hers. The door UNBOLTS, FLIES open. Mike comes to and glances up as Deacon storms into the ro drags him out screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ida stands just outside the doorway, lets them pass. She slides some surgical gloves on, shuts the door behind her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON - SHERYL as the door SHUTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, without his shirt, hangs by his wrists from iron shackles secured to the ceiling. (He's hooked up the same way the Young Man was in the opening scene of the story.) Deacon secures the last of the restraints.     Clyde ente walks straight up to Mike...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I at all unclear yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you understand what was expected of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but... How do you expect...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly you did not understand. You did not even attempt relations last evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you're asking to do is sick. You're sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have a problem when penetration was a sin, but when it's your wife, it's sick?!? Unbelievable. Clyde glares angrily at Mike, then heads to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew the rules, Michael. I warned you. Now, Deacon, here, will remind you. Mike turns to Deacon, who stands over the tool bench. of sharp instruments of torture lay before him. Clyde shuts the door on Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde shuts the door.     Ida waits, helps him with his c SHOOTING SCRIPT         OCTOBER 17, 2006         70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be late for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be home at the regular time? Clyde removes a set of keys from his pocket... NOTICE THE BOSTON RED SOX KEY CHAIN... They're Mike's keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might be a bit late. I have an errand that needs attending to. Clyde kisses Ida, exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon stands by the TOOL BENCH, his back to Mike. Deacon grabs several different SCARY INSTRUMENTS OF TORTURE, tes them out. Mike tries to see what he's doing. HORRIBLE SOUNDS, METAL STRIKING METAL, BLADES SHARPENING, ETC. Deacon finally selects a weapon, turns around... Mike stares at Deacon who holds a CAT-O'-NINE TAILS in hi hand. Deacon walks behind Mike...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do this.    Come on. Deacon pulls his arm back, WHIPS MIKE ACROSS THE BACK. MIKE SCREAMS IN AGONY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl hears MIKE'S SCREAMS, but she's in a predicament o her own. Sheryl's tied to chair. Her hand is secured to table top. She can't move it. Fingers separated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should concern yourself with what's about to happen to you. Ida opens a SEWING BOX, but instead of needles and yarn, removes a CLEAVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl looks at the cleaver, then... to her hand... the p finger separated and immobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Ida?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're so much smarter than me, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do. Admit it'cause I can see it in your eyes, darling. With your fancy schools and job and such. (Realizes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you are better than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't. Yes she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might surprise you, but I was quite the student back in the day. Straight A's. Every subject'cept for Science. Infuriated me how they tried to explain away the Lord's creations. Our teacher, Mr. Billings, once said... in the future, humans won't be born with a pinky finger'cause of evolution. (Frustration building)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all the... I shouted, "No! We are created in the Lord's image... not some nonsensical theory by Darwind." Sheryl stares at Ida, terrified would be an understatemen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose Mr. Billings and Mr. Darwind can stand up and cheer, because you, little lady... you're about to evolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike dangles...   HIS BACK CUT, BRUISED AND BLOODY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more.   Please.   No more. Deacon faces Mike, looks him square in the eyes. He walks back to the tool bench, lays the whipping device down. Mike breathes a touch easier, until... Deacon reappears, A JAR OF MOONSHINE in his hands. He dip one of his scarred fingers into the liquid and GENTLY tou a wound on Mike's body. The liquid stings.    Mike WINCES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with that? ANGLE ON - MIKE'S BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ida sits next to Sheryl.    She raises the cleaver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Ida, don't.    Don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I want to hurt a pretty thing like you? Pains me, but... until you and your husband obey, my hands, much like yours, are tied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know about your condition, Ida. It's not your fault. There are a lot of women that can't carry a baby full term. I know how much you're hurting. Ida takes her attention from the finger, starts to pay attention to Sheryl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know anything about me or what I've gone through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here for you now.      I'll help you. Please. Ida stares at Sheryl...    debating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deacon SPLASHES THE ENTIRE JAR OF MOONSHINE ON MIKE'S BAC A BLOOD-CURDLING SCREAM RINGS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ida and Sheryl turn in the direction of the SCREAM. This seems to bring Ida back from wherever she was, back to th matter at hand... Ida looks into Sheryl's tear-filled eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
